Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk java-1.7.1-ibm
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: java-1.7.1-ibm bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: IBM Java SE version 1.7.1 release includes the IBM Java Runtime Environment and the IBM Java Software Development Kit. This update fixes the following bug: The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 kernel does not abort transactions when executing a system call within the transaction. However, the kernel operates in Transactional Memory (TM) suspend mode, and therefore any actions taken by the system call are not subject to the transaction tracking. Consequently, if such a transaction is eventually aborted, the changes caused by the system call cannot be rolled back, possibly rendering the system unstable. This update addresses the problem and provides an iFix to work around it. Aborting a transaction that executes a system call no longer results in unwanted changes on the system. (BZ#1111463) All users of java-1.7.1-ibm are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, containing the IBM Java SE 7R1 SR1 release. All running instances of IBM Java must be restarted for this update to take effect. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
